message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has symptoms of vulvovaginal atrophy, which is common in postmenopausal women. Among the options, topical estrogen cream is the most appropriate pharmacotherapy for this condition. Oral fluconazole is used to treat fungal infections, topical nystatin is used for candidiasis, and oral metronidazole is used for bacterial vaginosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest atrophic vaginitis due to menopause, and topical estrogen cream is the recommended pharmacotherapy. Oral fluconazole and topical nystatin are used for yeast infections, which is not suggested in this case. Oral metronidazole is used for bacterial vaginosis or trichomoniasis, which are not suggested in this case either.

Oral fluconazole and topical nystatin are used to treat vaginal yeast infections, which is not indicated in this case. Oral metronidazole is used to treat bacterial vaginosis or trichomonas infection, which is not indicated in this case.

Topical estrogen cream is the most appropriate pharmacotherapy for this condition. Oral fluconazole is used to treat vaginal yeast infections, which is not the case here. Topical nystatin is used to treat fungal skin infections, not vaginal atrophy. Oral metronidazole is used to treat bacterial infections, but there are no signs of infection here.

Topical estrogen cream is the most appropriate pharmacotherapy. Oral fluconazole is used to treat fungal infections, which is not likely the cause of the patient's symptoms. Topical nystatin is used to treat fungal infections, which is not likely the cause of the patient's symptoms. Oral metronidazole is used to treat bacterial vaginosis or other bacterial infections, which is not likely the cause of the patient's symptoms.

Among the options, only topical estrogen cream can correct the hormonal changes associated with menopause and improve the symptoms. Oral fluconazole and topical nystatin are used to treat fungal vaginitis, while oral metronidazole is used to treat bacterial vaginosis.

Topical estrogen cream is the most appropriate pharmacotherapy for vaginal atrophy. The other options are used for different conditions: fluconazole for fungal infections, nystatin for candidiasis, and metronidazole for bacterial vaginosis.
